data.Sentence_cn: 各有所爱
data.Sentence: --- lesson 23  One man's meat is another man's poison

data.Sentence_cn: 在决定什么能吃而什么不能吃的时候，人们往往变得不合情理。
data.Sentence: People become quite illogical when they try to decide what can be eaten and what cannot be eaten.

data.Sentence_cn: 比如，如果你住在地中海地区，你会把章鱼视作是美味佳肴，
data.Sentence: If you lived in the Mediterranean, for instance, you would consider octopus a great delicacy.

data.Sentence_cn: 同时不能理解为什么有人一见章鱼就恶心。
data.Sentence: You would not be able to understand why some people find it repulsive.

data.Sentence_cn: 另一方面，你一想到动物油炸土豆就会反胃，但这在北方许多国家却是一种普通的烹饪方法。
data.Sentence: On the other hand, your stomach would turn at the idea of frying potatoes in animal fat -- the normally accepted practice in many northern countries.

data.Sentence_cn: 不无遗憾的是， 我们中的大部分人，生来就只吃某几种食品，而且一辈子都这样。
data.Sentence: The sad truth is that most of us have been brought up to eat certain foods and we stick to them all our lives.

data.Sentence_cn: 没有一种生物所受到的赞美和厌恶会超过花园里常见的蜗牛了。
data.Sentence: No creature has received more praise and abuse than the common garden snail.

data.Sentence_cn: 蜗牛加酒烧煮后，便成了世界上许多地方的一道珍奇的名菜。
data.Sentence: Cooked in wine, snails are a great luxury in various parts of the world.

data.Sentence_cn: 有不计其数的人们从小就知道蜗牛可做菜。
data.Sentence: There are countless people who, ever since their early years, have learned to associate snails with food.

data.Sentence_cn: 但我的朋友罗伯特却住在一个厌恶蜗牛的国家中。
data.Sentence: My friend, Robert, lives in a country where snails are despised.

data.Sentence_cn: 他住在大城市里的一所公寓里，没有自己的花园。
data.Sentence: As his flat is in a large town, he has no garden of his own.

data.Sentence_cn: 多年来，他一直让我把我园子里的蜗牛收集起来给他捎去。
data.Sentence: For years he has been asking me to collect snails from my garden and take them to him.

data.Sentence_cn: 一开始，他的这一想法没有引起我多大兴趣。
data.Sentence: The idea never appealed to me very much,

data.Sentence_cn: 后来有一天，一场大雨后，
data.Sentence: but one day, after heavy shower,

data.Sentence_cn: 我在花园里漫无目的地散步，突然注意到许许多多蜗牛在我的一些心爱的花木上慢悠悠地蠕动着。
data.Sentence: I happened to be walking in my garden when I noticed a huge number of snails taking a stroll on some of my prize plants.

data.Sentence_cn: 我一时冲动，逮了几十只，装进一只纸袋里，带着去找罗伯特。
data.Sentence: Acting on a sudden impulse, I collected several dozen, put them in a paper bag, and took them to Robert.

data.Sentence_cn: 罗伯特见到我很高兴，对我的薄礼也感到满意。
data.Sentence: Robert was delighted to see me and equally pleased with my little gift.

data.Sentence_cn: 我把纸袋放在门厅里，与罗伯特一起进了起居室，在那里聊了好几个钟头。
data.Sentence: I left the bag in the hall and Robert and I went into the living room where we talked for a couple of hours.

data.Sentence_cn: 我把蜗牛的事已忘得一干二净，罗伯特突然提出一定要我留下来吃晚饭，这才提醒了我。
data.Sentence: I had forgotten all about the snails when Robert suddenly said that I must stay to dinner.

data.Sentence_cn: 蜗牛当然是道主菜。
data.Sentence: Snails would, of course, be the main dish.

data.Sentence_cn: 我并不喜欢这个主意，所以我勉强跟着罗伯特走出了起居室。
data.Sentence: I did not fancy the idea and I reluctantly followed Robert out of the room.

data.Sentence_cn: 使我们惊愕的是门厅里到处爬满了蜗牛：
data.Sentence: To our dismay, we saw that there were snails everywhere:

data.Sentence_cn: 它们从纸袋里逃了出来，爬得满厅都是！
data.Sentence: they had escaped from the paper bag and had taken complete possession of the hall!

data.Sentence_cn: 从那以后，我再也不能看一眼蜗牛了。
data.Sentence: I have never been able to look at a snail since then.

title.title: One man's meat is another man's poison
